intro: Rhabdosciadium oligocarpum, commonly known as the narrow-fruit sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, dry fruits that are typically less than 1 centimeter in length. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
